topic.title: How to "unfollow" things on the zeronet Hello page?
topic.body: I have clicked on a lot of "Follow" links and now I wonder how to undo that again ;)

2_15EnNiQcFsavvvm7WHt7SCjCv4vV6Gyu7z.body: AFAIUI that's a question of setting up a DHT on that network and not using the default one.

1_1ARYQJCvFL9sbxiQWyKAuZkTTKbft8d8aZ.body:
> [nofish](#comment_378_1J3rJ8ecnwH2EPYa6MrgZttBNc61ACFiCj): Go to site, click the follow button again, then you can uncheck it.

Ah *duh* Thanks!

2_1GCsW9TFfjDsvcdmKPADq1n8Q3ha72UtDQ.body: Scheme, Go, Haskell in that order

1_1PBXqFewt3Y4KxdCKBbH3XUydM9BNMHLNW.body: Could you elaborate a bit on how the entries are generated? Also a little category filter would be nice :)

> [axx](#comment_3_1PBXqFewt3Y4KxdCKBbH3XUydM9BNMHLNW): we do index dht (millions of hashes per sec) -> http://dht.x4b.pw/, then recognize software and etc ... working on cats :D

In javascript? Sounds like a nice application for a ZeroNet page as well, distribute the analysis then combine the results for each peer...

1_15ymkjUYJS6tjUC35AekGMExZMN6iks8ma.body: If I read the source correctly you should be able to pass the browser with the '--open_browser' command line option.

1_1N9vyd78w2N6174aLsw7FvCk5Lij3Bu33Y.body: There are some "threads" on ZeroTalk that resemble subreddits, are these hard coded, for example the p2p stream...
